name: Paroxysmal Nocturnal Dissociative Episodes (PNDE)
chief_complaint: I wake up screaming and don't recognize my own family for several minutes
symptoms: Transient inability to recognize familiar people

lab_results.EEG: Normal during waking hours, abnormal theta waves during episodes

treatment: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) adapted for dissociative disorders
prognosis: Variable; some patients achieve full remission with therapy while others experience chronic episodic symptoms
description: A rare dissociative disorder characterized by sudden nocturnal episodes of profound disorientation and identity confusion. Episodes typically last 5-30 minutes and occur during NREM sleep transitions. Distinct from night terrors by the presence of preserved complex motor function and coherent speech during episodes.
